body.text: Angelica Joy came to us in need of a fresh image to relaunch their jewelry brand. Inspired by Angelica's family roots in Italy, we aimed to capture the magic of the Tuscan region. We developed an icon reminiscent of Italian architecture, harking towards the arch doorways found in quiet little towns. The mark also represents her initial with the strategic placement of the diamond in the center. As a part of this brand refresh, we also developed bespoke cards that would be mailed out with purchases as a keepsake and tactile brand touchpoint.

body.text: Rivet Coffee came to us in need of branding and packaging that would differentiate their brand from the dozens of other coffee roasters. After diving deep into brand discovery with Chris Dillow (Founder & Master Roaster), we developed a brand that was inspired by industry, craft, and a rich, all-American spirit. This was communicated through copy, color, illustration, typography, and even paper choice. Every detail mattered. Over the course of the project, we completed retail, wholesale, and sample coffee bags as well as a shipping box set. We created stationery, apparel, info cards, and digital assets for web and social.
body.html:
Rivet Coffee came to us in need of branding and packaging that would differentiate their brand from the dozens of other coffee roasters. After diving deep into brand discovery with Chris Dillow (Founder & Master Roaster), we developed a brand that was inspired by industry, craft, and a rich, all-American spirit. This was communicated through copy, color, illustration, typography, and even paper choice. Every detail mattered.

Over the course of the project, we completed retail, wholesale, and sample coffee bags as well as a shipping box set. We created stationery, apparel, info cards, and digital assets for web and social.

services.text: Visual Identity Packaging Web Design Illustration

body.text: Steadlight, originally known as Sallah Productions, came to us in need of a new brand image. We strategized a memorable and ownable name and tagline as well as redefining their visual identity. The repetition of circles in their symbol was inspired by speakers, lights, and knobs found on sound boards. The diagonal shape abstracly represents an “S” while also symbolizing the high-energy experience felt at live events.  Upon completion of the inital identity, we developed apparel and a bespoke stationery set. The business cards were screen printed with a blind deboss on Neenah Epic Black by Mama’s Sauce. The envelopes were digitaly printed on Neenah Cool Gray by Mingo Press.
body.html:
Steadlight, originally known as Sallah Productions, came to us in need of a new brand image. We strategized a memorable and ownable name and tagline as well as redefining their visual identity. The repetition of circles in their symbol was inspired by speakers, lights, and knobs found on sound boards. The diagonal shape abstracly represents an “S” while also symbolizing the high-energy experience felt at live events.

Upon completion of the inital identity, we developed apparel and a bespoke stationery set. The business cards were screen printed with a blind deboss on Neenah Epic Black by Mama’s Sauce. The envelopes were digitaly printed on Neenah Cool Gray by Mingo Press.

services.text: Name Ideation Visual Identity Apparel Stationary

body.text: Retrograde Coffee Roasters came to us in need of a packaging redesign, so we developed a flexible label and color system as well as typographically updating their brand. We left the astronaut untouched, but converted it to one color and used it in a more graphic way. They loved the bags so much that they asked us to expand the design across all of their branding. We had the opportunity to design their menus, cups, business cards, and signage along the way. The updated packaging and branding has been extremely well-received by their customers. The new identity has revitalized their image and has been creating positive notoriety among the community.
